title: Footage captures child abductor stalking girl in Kmart before sexually assaulting her in bushland
text:
Sterling Mervyn Free (pictured) pleaded guilty to three charges in relation to the kidnap and sexual assault of a seven-year-old girl last December

Chilling CCTV has captured the moment a young father kidnapped a seven-year-old girl from a Kmart store before he lured her to bushland and sexually assaulted her.

Sterling Free, now 27, pleaded guilty to three charges in the Brisbane District Court on Wednesday, including taking a child under 12 for immoral purposes, deprivation of liberty and indecent treatment.

He was arrested two days after the incident at Westfield North Lakes in Brisbane last December.

Nine News has obtained CCTV footage of the abduction, which shows Free stalking the toy aisles of the busy Kmart store.

He lures the girl away from her mother, who was shopping for Christmas presents nearby, telling her to 'follow me'.

CCTV shows Sterling Free stalking the toy aisles of Kmart at Westfield North Lakes last December, where he lures a seven-year-old girl to follow him

Footage shows Free calmly leaving the store with the little girl, who followed him close behind.

Westfield CCTV then shows the pair's every move as they wander around the shopping centre among dozens of oblivious shoppers.

Free takes the girl to his car and drives her to secluded bushland at Pumicestone Passage almost 30 kilometres away, where she was molested.

Sterling Free is captured leaving Kmart with the girl (circled) following closely behind

Free then drives the girl back to Westfield, where she's dropped off in a nearby car park.

She's captured on CCTV re-entering Westfield, alone and frightened as she searches for her frantic mother.

By that stage, the girl had been missing for more than 90 minutes and police had been contacted.

The pair are captured leaving Westfield, before Sterling Free takes the girl to his car and drives her to secluded bushland, where she is sexually assaulted

The 26-year-old took the girl from Kmart in North Lakes and drove her to Pumicestone Passage. He later dropped her off at a car wash near the shopping centre

The girl, seven, had been shopping with her mother when she wandered into a different aisle of the toy section (pictured). Free had been watching the girl and took his opportunity to abduct her

The girl was reunited with her mother, who found a scratch on the girl's back.

A Facebook post was circulated in search of the kidnapper. Free was arrested at his home two days later.

Prior to his arrest, Free had worked at a local Fantastic Furniture store.

'Mr Free's actions and his instructions to us have demonstrated a level of remorse,' his lawyer Shaune Irving told reporters outside court on Wednesday.

Sterling Mervyn Free (pictured) has been remanded in custody, he will appear in court for sentencing in October

The father-of-two drove with the girl to remote bushland more than half-an-hour away and assaulted her. Free was then captured on CCTV dropping her back at Kmart

'He's somewhat relieved that we have an end in sight and that the matter will be dealt with.'

However, Mr Irving would not go into details about the facts of the case.

'He's given us pretty detailed instructions that he wants to resolve the matter … and obviously have his punishment delivered and he wants to do that as quickly as possible.'

Free has been remanded in custody until sentencing on October 8.
description: Chilling CCTV has captured the moment a young father kidnapped a seven-year-old girl from a Kmart store in Brisbane before he lured her to bushland and sexually assaulted her.
authors: Kelsey Wilkie For Daily Mail Australia
